metadata.name: Phonology & Prosody
metadata.description: Sound structure and prosodic systems such as stress and pitch accent.

entries.definition: A system in which the relative pitch of a syllable determines word stress, as in Ancient Greek.
examples: Ancient Greek distinguishes meaning based on pitch accent, unlike Modern Greek stress accent.

entries.definition: A system in which the loudness or emphasis of a syllable determines word stress, as in Modern Greek.
Prominence of a syllable relative to others in a word (often realized through loudness, duration, or pitch).
A rhythmic unit of speech typically built around a vowel peak and optionally surrounding consonants.
The perceived highness or lowness of a sound, correlated with fundamental frequency (F0).
